summary.span: 封装数据绑定控件（如 、、 和 ）的与分页相关的属性，以允许该控件执行分页操作。

span.span: Encapsulates the paging-related properties of a data-bound control (such as , , , and ) that allow it to perform paging.

summary.span: 此类不能被继承。

span.span: This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类封装属性，这些属性允许数据源控件（如 、、和 ）执行分页。The class encapsulates the properties that allow data-source controls, such as the , , , and , to perform paging. 当向自定义数据绑定控件提供分页支持时，控件开发人员将使用此类。This class is used by control developers when providing paging support to a custom data-bound control. 此类使用最佳的可用方法对属于当前页的数据进行枚举。This class uses the best available method to enumerate over the data belonging to the current page. 如果基础数据源支持索引访问（如 和 ），则此类将使用它。If the underlying data source supports indexed access (such as and ), this class uses it. 否则，它将使用由 方法创建的枚举器。Otherwise, it uses the enumerator created by the method. 有关 实例的初始属性值的列表，请参阅 构造函数。For a list of initial property values for an instance of , see the constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，指示是否在数据绑定控件中启用自定义分页。

span.span: Gets or sets a value indicating whether custom paging is enabled in a data-bound control.

value.span: 如果启用自定义分页，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if custom paging is enabled; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用 属性指示是否启用自定义分页。Use the property to indicate whether custom paging is enabled. 自定义分页是由 控件专门提供的一种可选的分页类型。Custom paging is an optional type of paging provided specifically by the control. ASP.NET 版本2.0 数据绑定控件（例如 、和 ）使用服务器端分页，不支持自定义分页。ASP.NET version 2.0 data-bound control (such as , , and ) uses server-side paging and does not support custom paging. 自定义分页和服务器端分页互相排斥。Custom paging and server-side paging are mutually exclusive. 如果将 设置为 `true`，请确保将 "" 设置为 "`false`"。If you set to `true`, be sure that is set to `false`. 有关自定义分页的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information about custom paging, see .

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，指示是否在数据绑定控件中启用分页。

span.span: Gets or sets a value indicating whether paging is enabled in a data-bound control.

value.span: 如果启用分页，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if paging is enabled; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用 属性可指定数据绑定控件是否已启用分页。Use the property to specify whether a data-bound control has paging enabled. ASP.NET 版本2.0 数据绑定控件（例如 、和 ）还使用服务器端分页提供自动分页功能。ASP.NET version 2.0 data-bound controls (such as , , and ) also use server-side paging to provide automatic paging functionality. 有关服务器端分页的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information on server-side paging, see . 使用 控件时，还可以提供自己的自定义分页逻辑。When using the control, you can also provide your own custom paging logic. 有关自定义分页的详细信息，请参阅 和 。For more information on custom paging, see and . 有关对数据绑定控件的分页支持的详细信息，请参阅数据绑定控件的 `AllowPaging` 属性。For more information about paging support for data-bound controls, see the `AllowPaging` property of the data-bound control.

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，指示是否启用服务器端分页。

span.span: Gets or sets a value indicating whether server-side paging is enabled.

value.span: 如果启用服务器端分页，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if server-side paging is enabled; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks ASP.NET 版本2.0 数据绑定控件（例如 、和 ）通过服务器端分页提供自动分页功能。ASP.NET version 2.0 data-bound controls (such as , , and ) provide automatic paging functionality through server-side paging. 使用 ASP.NET 2.0 数据绑定控件时，请将此属性设置为 `true`。When using an ASP.NET 2.0 data-bound control, set this property to `true`. > [!NOTE] > 服务器端分页和自定义分页互相排斥。Server-side paging and custom paging are mutually exclusive. 如果将 设置为 `true`，请确保将 "" 设置为 "`false`"。If you set to `true`, be sure that is set to `false`.

summary.span: 从 中的指定索引位置开始，将数据源中的所有项复制到指定的 。

span.span: Copies all the items from the data source to the specified , starting at the specified index in the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此方法可从指定索引处开始，将数据源的内容复制到指定的 中。Use this method to copy the contents of the data source into the specified , starting at the specified index. 通常用于循环访问数据源中的项。The is often used to iterate through the items in the data source.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Count As Integer
public: property int Count { int get(); };

summary.span: 获取要从数据源使用的项数。

span.span: Gets the number of items to be used from the data source.

value.span: 要从数据源使用的项数。

span.span: The number of items to be used from the data source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用 属性可确定要从数据源使用的项数。Use the property to determine the number of items to be used from the data source. 返回的值取决于是否启用分页以及是否使用自定义分页。The value returned depends on whether paging is enabled and whether custom paging is used. - 如果禁用分页（通过将 属性设置为 `false`），则返回 属性的值。If paging is disabled (by setting the property to `false`), the value of the property is returned. - 如果启用了分页（通过将 属性设置为 `true`）并启用 `true` 了自定义分页，则将返回 属性的值。If paging is enabled (by setting the property to `true`) and custom paging is enabled (by setting the property set to `true`), the value of the property is returned. - 如果启用分页（通过将 属性设置为 `true`）并且 属性设置为 `false`，则返回 属性的值。If paging is enabled (by setting the property to `true`) and the property is set to `false`, the value of the property is returned. - 如果启用了分页（通过将 属性设置为 `true`），则禁用自定义分页（通过设置 属性 `false`）， 属性设置为 `true`，则 属性的值将在返回之前从 属性的值中减去。If paging is enabled (by setting the property to `true`), custom paging is disabled (by setting the property `false`), and the property is set to `true`, the value of the property is subtracted from the value of the property before it is returned. > [!NOTE] > 如果 属性包含 `null`，则返回0。If the property contains `null`, 0 is returned.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用 属性来确定数据源中的项数。Use the property to determine the number of items in the data source. 如果使用自定义分页或服务器端分页，则返回 属性的值;否则，返回数据源中的总项数。If custom paging or server-side paging is used, the value of the property is returned; otherwise, the total number of items in the data source is returned. > [!NOTE] > 如果 属性包含 `null`，则返回0。If the property contains `null`, 0 is returned.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此方法创建一个可循环访问的 ，以获取数据源中的每一项。Use this method to create a that can be iterated through to get each item in the data source. 若要访问枚举器中当前位置的项，请使用 属性。To access the item at the current position in the enumerator, use the property. 使用 方法移动到集合中的下一项。Use the method to move to the next item in the collection. 若要将枚举器移动到其初始位置，请使用 方法。To move the enumerator to its initial position, use the method. > [!NOTE] > 最初获取枚举器或使用 方法将枚举数移到集合中的第一项时，必须调用 方法。When you initially get the enumerator or use the method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection, you must call the method. 否则， 属性表示的项是不确定的。Otherwise, the item represented by the property is undefined.
